definition: may I offer a bit of advice
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

sentences.english: I'd advise you not to associate with him, he's a bad lot.
sentences.chinese: 我奉劝你不要和他交往，他是一个坏蛋。

sentences.english: I myself urge you to put friendship before all human affairs.
sentences.chinese: 我自己奉劝你们将友谊置于人类事务之首。

sentences.english: I would urge Mourinho to listen to Spalletti's interviews.
sentences.chinese: 我奉劝穆里尼奥去听听斯帕莱蒂的访谈。

sentences.english: I told Sally it was foolish to marry that man.
sentences.chinese: 我早奉劝过萨利嫁给那个男人是多么愚蠢。

sentences.english: I would caution you against undue optimism .
sentences.chinese: 我奉劝你不要过于乐观。

sentences.english: Right now, many commentators are urging Mr. Obama to think small.
sentences.chinese: 当前，很多评论家都在奉劝奥巴马不要过于好高骛远。

sentences.english: Friendly advice to China - Dont underestimate them .
sentences.chinese: 奉劝中国人，不要轻视越南。

sentences.english: Do yourself a favor, don't buy the book.
sentences.chinese: 奉劝你一句，别买这本书。

sentences.english: the mender recommends me to amend the legend agenda.
sentences.chinese: 修理工提议奉劝我修改传奇议程。

sentences.english: So I urge members of congress to act without delay.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我奉劝国会议员们立即行动起来。

sentences.english: So perhaps you can skip those sneaks, say the study authors.
sentences.chinese: 研究报告的作者们奉劝你也许可以放弃那些运动鞋。

definition: to give sb a word of advice/advice/counsel/a wise word
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
you must not/Please don't.../be sure not to/on no account (do it)
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
variant of 告誡|告诫[gao4 jie4]
to challenge the law (idiom)/to knowingly violate the law
to remember with reverence/to bear in mind/to keep in mind
to keep one's eyes open (idiom)/to be on one's guard/to be clear-eyed
The sea of bitterness has no bounds, turn your head to see the shore (idiom). Only Buddhist enlightenment can allow one to shed off the abyss of worldly suffering./Repent and ye shall be saved!
pinyin: ku3 hai3 wu2 bian1 , hui2 tou2 shi4 an4
